summary: This document is a series of email exchanges discussing the selection of a Special Master in the Epstein case, confusion over who concurred with the selection of Mr. Ocariz, and a request for a de novo review of evidence underlying a proposed indictment. It reveals internal procedural discussions and a review of investigative materials.

events.title: Special Master Selection Discussion

events.title: De Novo Review Requested
events.description: A request is made to conduct a de novo review of the evidence underlying the proposed indictment against Epstein, following recent correspondence from Kirkland & Ellis.

keyFacts: There was internal confusion and procedural issues regarding the selection of a Special Master, specifically whether Jay originally concurred with Mr. Ocariz's selection.
A de novo review of the evidence underlying the proposed indictment against Epstein was requested, indicating a reassessment of the case.
The correspondence references underlying investigative materials such as 302s, state grand jury transcripts, and interview transcripts being compiled for review.
The email chain shows communication breakdowns, with periods of 'radio silence' as parties began communicating only with specific individuals.
